info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MERCER...NORTHERN BEAVER...SOUTHWESTERN VENANGO...EASTERN LAWRENCE AND BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 208 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grove City to near Beaver Falls. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cranberry, Butler, Beaver Falls, Grove City, Monaca, Ellwood City, Homeacre-Lyndora, New Brighton, Shanor-Northvue, Beaver, Meridian, and Zelienople. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 11 and 27. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 80 and 113. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 22 and 41. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
